pros:
Creative and ambitious place. A lot of autonomy and opportunities to make a real difference if you want to. 
Relatively young and definitely punching above its weight. 
It's growing fast and offers an amazing and genuinely relevant education and training experience for new generation fashion and retail professionals. Really strong industry connections which benefits the students tremendously.   
Staff are super friendly, it's an inclusive place with a fairly informal culture. Lots of social events and staff perks are good. Total opposite from a  stuffy corporate feel, it has a very relaxed vibe. Great location.
cons: Usual growing pains as it's expanding.  Some things are very structured and standardised others not so. But there have been a lot of positive changes recently and a lot of new people are joining as its expanding. Compare to other places its overall a great place to work.

pros: Great peers , teaching methods and access to industry for the cohort. Great company benefits
cons: Can be chaotic with last minute changes and over prescribed students vs staff. Due to this lack of progression as needed to remain in the GL position

review_title: Has vastly Improved over time! Overall a great place to work
pros: - growing support and benefits package seeks to recognise staff - attempts to collaborate with staff on strategy - staff! So many friendships made! - encouragement for innovation - industry insights
cons: - whilst steps are being made, more focus needs to be on development and support for teachers - further acknowledgment of growing support needs of students particularly in wake of pandemic. Sometimes a disjoint between senior leadership and the real challenges in the classroom and delivery. - communication and clarity around job roles and boundaries

pros: Well resourced college for 16 year olds plus.
cons: Stressful place to work. Little respect for teaching staff. Never feel secure or valued.

pros: Skilled teachers and a real focus on getting students ahead with their careers.
cons: Such a strange management style from management. They mainly hid in their offices and occasionally walked around shouting at teaching staff. No ability to listen.

pros:
- Friendly colleagues 
- Centrally located 
- Industry connections
cons:
- Inflexible working
- Poor communication between teaching staff and management
- Salary

pros: Big Central London college, some good courses for 16 to 19 year old.
cons: No job security. Very stressful. High turn over of teaching staff.

job_title: Corporate Office Staff in London, England
pros:
Great teams, lovely colleagues who are also friends. Small enough to get to know each other but big enough to feel like you’re part of a dynamic and growing business. 
Good salary 
Great courses & opportunities for students 
Staff genuinely care about the work we all do 
Great access to CPD through visiting experts 
Central London location 
Fashion centred
cons:
Things change a lot so every year you have to get used to new ways of doing things
The building is small and lacks in quiet space away from the open plan office if you want to concentrate on important work

review_title: Very stressful place to teach.  Experience & expertise not valued.
pros: A well-resourced college, lots of students in central London
cons: huge class sizes and unhelpful cruel management

pros: the work environment is great, everyone is very friendly
cons: the building is too small for the number of students

pros: Location and library facilities are great
cons: Dated laptops for students, manual heavy caddy that lecturers have to wheel in and out of classrooms, closed off work culture

review_title: It's a college with none of the teacher benefits!
pros:
Some nice people work here and as I was about to leave there was a big improvement in the Senior Team and the overall vision of the place. 
Lots of ambitious staff who enjoy teaching 
Good IT in the classrooms and good support 
Good Location
Good industry links
cons:
The open-plan office is hard to work in.  
No teaching pension  - and the one they offer is much, much lower 
Holiday allocation is much lower than in other educational institutes.
Salary below jobs of similar level in London
The workload is very high and staff struggle to manage it 
Very high student numbers in classes 
Students put on courses they are not suitable for (that's the whole of FE though!)

review_title: Support staff unsupported & let down by management. Negligible/Non-existent financial rewards. Excellency not recognized
pros: Excellent & convenient location, mostly great staff, professional, conscientious & dedicated. Quite good atmospheres on occasions.
cons: Very low wages compared to other places, feeling of not being valued, extremely hierarchical, a small percentage of staff who are able to get away with idleness, lack of productivity & incompetence.  .

pros:
- Small and friendly culture 
-Good facilities for staff and students 
- Good holiday allowance
-Management communicate with staff and seek feedback to improve 
- Genuinely great links with big brands in the fashion retail world 
- They invest in technology and systems 
- You feel listened to and important as a member of staff
cons:
- Financial reward could be improved 
- Better planning of activities in advance needed, teams being aware of what other teams are doing

pros:
- They don't care what you do.
- They take you on school trips to interesting countries (but you have to pay for the teachers, they rip you off and when you ask for a breakdown, they wont tell you)
- min 2 days a week
cons:
everything to be honest
- they don't look at your work
- teachers don't know what they're speaking about
- every teacher tells you something different 
- college encourage you to work part time on the side then wants you to take time off work the whole time
- just awful

review_title: Great office location  and nice people to work with
pros: Great Central location - relaxed work atmosphere.
cons: The quality of the average student is low. This makes it difficult for lecturers and also to find work placements for students. Very few work benefits. The office is crowded and noisy.

pros:
Friendly, inclusive atmosphere
Great team work
Good location - based centrally in Tottenham Court Road
Opportunity for training and growth in roles
cons:
Communication between different departments could be improved
More health employee benefits

pros:
-Good sources to teach
-Access to several learning rresources
cons:
-Senior Managements overall ability to manage
-No work/life balance
-Poor benefits and overall pay rates
-Cultural and social benefits are minimal
No competitive IT salaries or bonus scheme.
